title: [QUESTION] SKMask.Create has uint rowBytes parameter?
body:
The signature of `SKMask.Create` is 

```cs
    public static unsafe SKMask Create(
      ReadOnlySpan<byte> image,
      SKRectI bounds,
      uint rowBytes,
      SKMaskFormat format)
```

So `rowBytes` is an `uint` here.

However, the `RowBytes` properties of the other classes return an `int`, e.g. `SKBitmap.RowBytes`

Is this by design?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Probably not... We can add an `int` overload.

Thanks for reporting all these annoying things. Hopefully after you are done with it, all the annoyances are gone and people start sending chunks of SkiaSharp API to loved ones on Valentine's Day... 😆
